divs: sighting detailsas i type this, i do not have an exact date and time, as the event occurred in 1976. i list it as 19 august 1976 at approximately 10 pm because i remember the moon phase (full) and the approximate position in the sky. it was either a friday or saturday evening. i was 11 years old, about to turn 12. my eyeglass prescription had recently been renewed, so my eyesight was excellent. at the time, i was an aviation enthusiast. even at age 11, i would consider myself a competent observer. we lived near the flight path of hartsfield-atlanta airport, so i was exposed to many different viewings of civilian aircraft both in day and night conditions. the sky was fully dark, except for the full moon over the southwestern horizon. there were no clouds. my grandmother and i were sitting on her porch at their home in lovejoy, georgia (south of atlanta). we were just talking about things in general, and watching light aircraft from a local airport, the now-demolished south expressway airport, travel on a standard flightpath from north to south (i always presumed from the atlanta airspace to the macon-warner robbins air hubs). as the aircraft flew past, they were close enough that we could hear their reciprocating engines and easily spot their headlights and navigation lights. the flight path would have been between the i-75 and us hwy 41 corridors as they moved south from the greater atlanta, ga area. after viewing the civilian traffic for a while, i spotted the object i am reporting emerge from behind the roof of my grandmother's abode. it was a solid, white, luminescent oval. it was not a reflection of moonlight or other light source. i immediately noted that it was a solid light, not a combination of lights as would be expected from a normal light aircraft. i also noticed that the object emitted no discernible sound. the ufo was following the same flight path as the civilian aircraft we had been observing, and it was traveling at the same speed (possibly trying to be inconspicuous?). i remember pointing at it and saying, "granny, that's a ufo." it was obvious that it wasn't anything i had ever seen before. a moment after i pointed the object out, it proceeded to defy the known laws of physics. from my perspective, it seemed to vanish, and then instantaneously reappear about 3 degrees above and to the south of its previous position. it then immediately vanished again and reappeared on the same flight path and maintained its previous speed (i have always assumed that it was just moving so fast that my eyes could not catch it as it "zig-zagged", and i only saw it at one point in it's "jump"). needless to say, my young heart jumped when i saw the maneuver. i asked my grandmother if she saw it do that, and she replied that she had, so i knew it wasn't just a trick of my own eyes. as the ufo continued on its course, it was about to pass behind a cedar tree that was planted in my grandmother's front yard. i told her to keep an eye on it, and i jumped off the porch. i lost sight of the object as it moved behind the tree. i circled around the north side of the tree, but when i reached the other side, the ufo was gone. i asked my grandmother if she saw what happened, and she said that the ufo had emerged from behind the tree, and then suddenly shot off like a tracer bullet (she pointed in the direction of the full moon). throughout the encounter, there was no sound whatsoever. notably, throughout sub-sonic to apparent super-(perhaps hyper-)sonic maneuvers, there was no sonic boom. conclusions\important facts\observations: - whatever the object was, it was able to instaneously accelerate to absurd speeds and decelerate\change course with no noticible necessity to obey newtonian laws concerning inertia. - it was luminescent, and a constant brightness. the outline (oval, as pharmaceutical-capsule-shaped) of the object was clear and sharp. - it made no discernible noise whatever (there was a housecat sitting on the bench with us, and it had no reaction whatever to the ufo). - it was following a civilian aircraft flight path (as a side note, where the flight path passed over there is today a county jail. this is how i calculated the approximate distance). - when my grandmother and i, ground-based observers, spotted it and reacted to its presence, it reacted as well (no way of knowing if there was a causal relationship there, could just be coincidence). - distance would have been probably about 2000 feet (less than a mile, but more than 1000 feet based on the size of the civilian aircraft we were previously observing). - the ufo was about the same size as a civilian, single-engined light aircraft. - my grandmother, the co-witness, has since passed on. thank you for giving us the venue to post this event for others to compare similarities. my perspective on the universe and our place in it has never been the same since this event.
